from these comments its sounds like it works just fine, for those who dont want to install anything just follow these instructions:

start menu/run/ type "regedit" and press enter,
this will take you to the registry editor

now follow this directory:
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE/Software/Microsoft/WindowsNT/CurrentVersion/WPAEvents

when you get to WPAEvents in the righthand collum there should be "OOBETimer" 
right click it and go to "modify"
Change the numbers in there to :

FF D5 71 D6 8B 6A 8D 6F d5 33 93 FD (this works with windows xp home and pro, both 32 and 64bit versions)

when you've entered them right click on the file "WPAEvents" and go into "permissions"

in there highlight "SYSTEM" and underneith it check the two boxes under "deny" and click "OK"

Phew thats it!!! i know it looks comlicated but a compitant novice should be able to follow
these instructions!

i tried this when i used up the amount of times you can activate windows xp, it worked a treat!

Ok, I ran this for a month and then the dreaded "you have x number of days to register" appeared. I thought all was ok until it got to 0 days and locked me out :(

But when I would hit yes, activate now, it would say that this product was already activated. And then it would take me back to the original screen.

I did the following steps, and now it is working again, with no activation warning. I think step 1 is necessary to reset windows to its original activation state. It didn't work otherwise.

1.
"start menu/run/ type "regedit" and press enter,
this will take you to the registry editor

now follow this directory:
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE/Software/Microsoft/WindowsNT/CurrentVersion/WPAEvents

when you get to WPAEvents in the righthand collum there should be "OOBETimer" 
right click it and go to "modify"
Change the numbers in there to :

FF D5 71 D6 8B 6A 8D 6F d5 33 93 FD (this works with windows xp home and pro, both 32 and 64bit versions)"

2. Press F8 while windows is booting, go into safe mode. Then re-apply the antiwga crack provided.

I don't know what went wrong, whether it was a windows update that screwed it up or what, but this fixed it for me. I hope this works for you. 

New downloaders: this still seems to be the best way of getting XP activated, even with this minor hicup. Good luck.

I can't remember which one it is, but one of Microsoft's updates makes the computer verify if it is WGA (Windows Genuine Authentication). Most people don't know how that be default (as well as very persistently) Windows XP has a nasty habit of auto-downloading and auto-installing without asking. It's like that upon the initial installation, it nags the hell out of you about your computer not being setup that way and it sometimes *from my own experience* has turned itself on. That last one was probably from a Microsoft Update though... in my own opinion, here's what you should do:

1. get vista, windows 7 or linux (free BSD)
2. activate xp and look into the updates thing
3. setup your own WSUS server to "push" updates **this can also "authenticate" OS' for authenticity**
4. don't have xp hooked up to the internet
5. don't use Windows Updates


###Important - if you by chance you get the whole "Your version of Windows may not be valid crap, just unhide system files, do a search for *.wga files, delete them and reboot###
